data.name: 4 By 4 Kakurasu Solver
data.description:
Kakurasu

sometimes called Bokkusu is a Japanese logic puzzle with simple rules.
The goal is to fill some of the cells with 'X' in such a way that: 1. The 'X'-cells on each row sum up to the number on the right. 2. The 'X'-cells on each column sum up to the number on the bottom. 3. If a 'X'-cell is first on its row/column its value is 1. If it is second its value is 2 etc. For more info, see tutorial video or play it online.

Example

1 2 3 4 +-----+-----+-----+-----+ 1 | | | X | X | 7 +-----+-----+-----+-----+ 2 | X | X | | X | 7 +-----+-----+-----+-----+ 3 | | X | | X | 6 +-----+-----+-----+-----+ 4 | | X | X | | 5 +-----+-----+-----+-----+ 2 9 5 6

Task

Write a method that takes an array of values as an argument and returns the solution as a string.
The first four values of the input array will be the target sums for each row, from top to bottom; the last four values will be the target sums for each column, from right to left. The size of the grid is 4x4 and the input array always consists of 8 valid numbers (from 1 to 10). In the example above, the order would be ```7, 7, 6, 5, 6, 5, 9, 2```.
The result should return ```" XX\nXX X\n X X\n XX "```. Good Luck!
